alert.note: Alert for Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 2:30PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...RISING WATER LEVELS ON SMALL STREAMS AND CREEKS DRAINING THE BROOKS RANGE... A series of fronts will impact the region, bringing copious amounts of widespread rain that will cause water levels to rise on small streams and creeks draining the south slopes of the Western Brooks Range. Additional rainfall amounts will range from 1.50 to 2.50 inches, with localized amounts up to 3.00 inches, primarily north of Ambler through Friday. Rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are expect in the Norton Sound Region and Nulato Hills. At this time, we are anticipating the higher water levels to only impact small streams and creeks across the area. No major flooding is expected for the mainstem rivers. Those traveling and recreating on rivers and streams draining the Western Brooks Range are encouraged to monitor water levels since some exposed gravel bars could become inundated due to runoff from the rainfall. For the latest weather forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks, and for the latest river forecasts go to www.weather.gov/aprfc.
